posts.cooked:
Hi there,

I’m new to the community but quite old to Signal, having used it from my iPhone since July 2017.

I’m really glad Signal exists, in its current form, but there is a very basic functionality which I think is sorely missing: copy some text from a message.

The reasons one could be willing are, I think, endless, but please let me just enumerate my last “cr*p moments” with Signal:

  • Copy a received hyperlink to paste it into my secure browser (Firefox Focus)
  • Copy a received phone number to paste it into a new contact
  • Copy a received misspelled word to resend it to the sender and make fun of it
  • Copy a proposed modification to a document and paste it into the relevant document
  • Copy part of a message and… (add your own usage scenario here)!

The above point are obviously valid if I’m not totally moronic and I’m missing the very simple way to them!

I see that in the latest Signal incarnation a “long press” action have been added to add a “reaction” to a message: that’s a feature I’ve honestly never missed, but I now feel an opportunity might have been lost to add something of probably more general utility…

Thanks to the developers and the community for letting Signal happen!

Sergio

link_counts.title: Why don't we have a copy/paste option?
Copy and paste function missing in iOS

posts.cooked: Long press and when you see the reactions on the bottom in the middle the copy symbol.

Yeap, that’s feasible, but it copy the whole message and to e.g. copy-paste a phone number into a contact I must first paste the whole message into a new iOS Note and from there isolate the relevant part, copy it and then paste into the contact (and then get rid of the useless temporary note, which by the way could contain some info I’m not happy to put into an iOS note…)

Yes but that’s the same behavior like in WhatsApp. You can copy bubbles - that’s it.
If you want to copy more specific, you should install Signal Desktop on your Computer.

sergio:

paste the whole message into a new iOS Note

You could also paste it into the message box of the conversation you copied it from, or even “Note To Self”, that way the information is still inside Signal, and even if you accidentally send it somehow, it doesn’t go to anyone unintended.

Another possibility is to forward the message to “Note To Self”, which will enter the text into the message box, which you can then select and copy from (unconfirmed, though, as I have Android and don’t know whether the iOS app behaves the same in this area)

Herohtar:

Another possibility is to forward the message to “Note To Self”, which will enter the text into the message box, which you can then select and copy from

That works (thanks for the idea!) and it is a better solution than using Notes as a temporary buffer, but nevertheless I see it as a convoluted solution around a substantial limitation, and sharing this limitation with WhatsApp doesn’t makes me much happier…

sergio:

and sharing this limitation with WhatsApp doesn’t makes me much happier…

But Signal or WhatsApp or iMessage or whatever are full of such limitations.
Who finds this more important than other things, will use email.
It’s not only that Signal does not have sufficient developers for every feature, it’s also difficult to add such things on a small smartphone while still having a good user experience.
I doubt this will come soon or maybe never.

I agree wholeheartedly with @sergio’s feature request! Furthermore, I don’t think this is a particularly difficult feature to implement, despite @Marat’s discouraging comments.

Here’s one appealing design: At least on Android, long-pressing a message reveals a circled-i “Message details” button. Pressing it shows the message again, along with additional information. There’s no reason that text selection (with OS-standard copying) couldn’t be enabled on this version of the message, since currently there are no touch interactions enabled at all. This would result in a much more pleasant workflow than requiring a user find someplace temporary to copy the message into.

What do you all think of this? (Thanks!)

Good idea @joshuahhh! I subscribe to that!

Thanks!

posts.name: Bryan
posts.cooked:
Makes sense to me, too!

Now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go bang rocks together to extract my package tracking code from a long sms I just received…

joshuahhh:

At least on Android, long-pressing a message reveals a circled-i “Message details” button. Pressing it shows the message again, along with additional information. There’s no reason that text selection (with OS-standard copying) couldn’t be enabled on this version of the message, since currently there are no touch interactions enabled at all.

Interestingly, at least on Android, the OS standard text selection and copy actions already work in the expanded (full) message view for very long messages (with a “Read more” link). On another note, the “Read more” link doesn’t work in the message details view. Would be great to have these two views behave the same way (on all OSes).

Related:

  • Copy button after pressing "read more" on a long message
  • Quote/reply to selected characters (only a part of the message text)

By the way: I’ve changed this topic’s category (from iOS only to a general feature request), since it at least accounts for both the Android and iOS version.

link_counts.title: Quote/reply to selected characters (only a part of the message text)
Copy button after pressing "read more" on a long message

posts.name: Richlv
posts.cooked:
Currently there seems to be only one way to copy text from Signal messages - by long-tapping a message, then using the controls at the bottom of the screen. Two issues here:

a) This only allows to copy the whole message text.
b) The controls are disconnected from the action, and most users seem not to notice them at all.

While b) is a a notable UX issue (users are requesting to send messages to them via other means, as they cannot get anything useful out of Signal), this particular request is about a).

Preferably, long-tap on a message would allow to select parts of the text right away.
As a minimum, one would expect to be able to long-tap the message text and select parts of it (like a phone number, for example) and copy that.

Another use case (similar to the one with the phone number) is when someone sends you a place/address and you need to copy it into maps/calendar/a contact.

Just had the case and well… used the desktop app to send it back to me as a note and copy it from my phone. Not very convenient…

Thanks for repeating what’s been written a few posts above yours

Anyway, at least on Android, I’m sure realizing the proposed solution would be no more than a no-brainer-one-line-change.

Xashyar:

But even that would only a very partial solution that only works on very long messages. It would definitely be great to be able to select partial text in any message. I run across this issue all the time.

posts.name: Volodymyr
posts.cooked:
I create the same feature request for Android, but moderators sent me here.

My idea was:

The easiest solution I see is to change behaviour of the text of the message to selectable in the Information window , that opened from the bubble long-tap menu.

And I saw the same propose from @joshuahhh.

Why is this feature still not implemented after 4 years? It is so simple (at least in Android)

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Because the project has other priorities (security patches, privacy improvements, critical bug fixes)
